GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles, on default sorted by created_at column in descending order

queries_description.topic: filters articles by the given topic
queries_description.sort-by: sorts articles by the given column (author, title, article_id, topic, created_at, votes, article_img_url, comment_count)
queries_description.order: order articles in the given order (asc, desc)

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: return a single article object with given id

article.title: Eight pug gifs that remind me of mitch
article.author: icellusedkars

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: returns an array of comments for a given article

commments.body: Oh, I've got compassion running out of my nose, pal! I'm the Sultan of Sentiment!
commments.author: butter_bridge

commments.body: The owls are not what they seem.
commments.author: icellusedkars

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: posts a new comment and returns it to the client

comment.body: I don't know about you, but I am a fan of lurking.
comment.author: lurker

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: increments/decrements the vote property of a specific article and returns the updated article to the client

article.title: Eight pug gifs that remind me of mitch
article.author: icellusedkars

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: deletes a comment with the given comment_id and sends 204 status code with no body response to the client

GET /api/users.description: responds with an array of user objects

GET /api/users/:username.description: returns an user object with given username

PATCH /api/comments/:comment_id.description: increments(positive num)/decrements(negative num) the vote property of a specific comment and returns the updated comment to the client
